description:
Drs. Amanda Curie oversees the radiotherapy health area as a well-respected, certified radiotherapist in the Milan area. She completed her bachelor of science in biomedical sciences at the University of South Florida. After she had completed her B.S., she continued her education and earned her master’s of public health degree with a concentration at the Harvard School of Public Health. Afterward, she attended the University of South Florida College of Medicine, where she completed her medical degree. During this time, she became a member of the Alpha Omega Alpha Medical Honor Society.
Upon graduating, Drs. Curie completed an internship in internal medicine. Her residency at the University of South Florida College of Medicine in Tampa, FL, focused on radiotherapy.
She brings all of her knowledge and enthusiasm for helping others to CPM clinic. She improves physical health and patients’ confidence with the services she supplies.
Amanda is an energetic practitioner who enjoys providing evidence-based, exceptional care and educating patients also on lifestyle changes for better overall health. Her experiences and interest in treating a variety of conditions have motivated and inspired her career in radiotherapy.

Dr. Robert Atkins is an American physician and cardiologist, best known for the "Atkins Nutritional Approach", or "Atkins Diet", a popular but controversial way of eating that requires close control of carbohydrate consumption, emphasizing protein and fat as the primary sources of dietary calories in addition to a controlled number of carbohydrates from vegetables.
Dr. Willem Einthoven is a Dutch doctor and physiologist. He invented the first practical electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG) in 1903 and received the Nobel Prize in Medicine.

Dr. Frederic Edward Mohs is a physician and general surgeon, developed the Mohs micrographic surgery (MMS) technique to remove skin cancer lesions while still a medical student at the University of Wisconsin–Madison. The Mohs procedure is considered the best method for treating certain types of skin cancer, because it has very high cure rates for even high-risk lesions, combined with maximal preservation of healthy tissues

Dr. Jeffrey Alan Klein is an American dermatologist from Southern California, who described the tumescent technique for liposuction surgery in 1987, which according to Hayashree Venkataram "revolutionized liposuction surgery" by "permit[ting] liposuction totally by local anaesthesia and with minimal blood loss." He is the author of Tumescent Technique: Tumescent Anesthesia & Microcannular Liposuction, a textbook on liposuction safety and effectiveness.

J. William Harbour, M.D., is an ophthalmologist, ocular oncologist and cancer researcher. He currently serves as the vice-chairman for Translational Research and director of ocular oncology at the Bascom Palmer Eye Institute and the associate director for basic research at the Sylvester Comprehensive Cancer Center of the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine. His clinical practice focuses on intraocular tumors, including uveal (ocular) melanoma, retinoblastoma, lymphoma and other neoplasms. His field of research includes the genetics and genomics of cancer, with a focus on prognostic biomarkers, mechanisms of metastasis, and molecular targeted therapies. He has given over 300 invited scientific lectures, and published over 150 peer-reviewed scientific articles and book chapters. Dr. Harbour founded the Ocular Oncology Service at the Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis, where he was the Paul A. Cibis Distinguished Professor of Ophthalmology & Visual Sciences.

Ernst Ludwig Alfred Hegar, aka Alfred Hegar, is a German gynecologist famous for developing new medical tools and techniques. Among the many techniques and instruments he developed were Hegar's sign and Hegar dilators, as well as Hegar's operation, an operation for repairing a ruptured perineum. His works are still widely discussed at colleges of obstetrics worldwide.

Otis Webb Brawley is an American physician who serves as Chief Medical and Scientific Officer and Executive Vice President of the American Cancer Society. He is board certified in internal medicine and medical oncology and is a Master of the American College of Physicians, Fellow of the American Society of Clinical Oncology, and a Fellow of the American College of Epidemiology. He is a member of the Institute of Medicine now known as the National Academy of Medicine.
Dr. Richard C. Agnew is a specialist in Heart transplant and lung transplant. He mainly treats aortic aneurysms, congestive heart failures ans heart valve diseases.
Drs. Staci E. Beamer is specialized in Chest surgery and Esophagitis. She is actively researching Minimally invasive thoracic surgery and Thoracic oncology. She also likes knitting btw.

Dr. Richard C. Daly is one of our senior members, with over 40 years of procedures in our clinic. He treated many cardiac diseases, mostly specializing in Coronary bypass surgery, Heart valve repair and Ventricular assist device insertion. He is a pioneer of the Robotic assisted mitral valve repair (minimally invasive) procedure.
Dr. Steven Bowers is one of our youngest and promising surgeons, specializing in Laparoscopic surgery. He is currently actively writing papers on experimental procedures.
Drs. Sarah A. McLaughlin is our top surgeon in breast cancer procedures. She is currently specialized in breast cancer and lymphedema, researching in Oncoplastic breast surgery.
Dr. Enrique Elli is our most valuable surgeon. He treats mostly Hernia, Esophageal cancer and Gastroparesis. He is one of the top researchers in Abdominal wall hernias procedures.

Dr. Jonathan Fillmore is one of our youngest but most active dermatologist, also performing difficult procedures as Craniofacial implantation and Dental implant surgery. He is specialized in treatment of Obstructive sleep apnea and TMJ disorders.

Dr. Kevin Arce is mostly focused on Maxillofacial reconstruction and Maxillofacial benign and malignant pathology. He is our specialist on Pediatric and Adolescent dermatology, performing Dental surgery and Reconstructive surgery.
Drs. Thelma G. Barnes is our specialist in treating eye Glaucoma. But, she mostly performs our base eye care services, like glass and contact lenses fitting.

Dr. Syril K. Dorairaj is our laser expert. He performs all the procedures releated to Cataract surgery and Laser eye surgery. He is specialized in the usage of cutting-edge procedures, like Femtosecond laser-assisted cataract surgery and Continuous monitoring of IOP.

Dr. William Brown is on our top researchers, with a long career of publications. He is actively developing new procedures in eye care. Given his long experience, he is the responsible of the eye care area at our structure.
Dr. John J. Woog is our specialist in Cornea diseases, known worldwide for the Graves disease. He currently performs Blepharoplasty and Tear duct probing.
Dr. F. Spencer Chivers is our sports guy: he mostly treat all sport related injuries and diagnose them. He currently performs CT scans and MRI, while also performing Sport specific rehabilitation.
Dr. Kristopher W. Cummings is specialized in cardio-related radiography, diagnosing heart diseases. He currently treats Cardiomyopathy and Pulmonary hypertension.
Drs. Marina E. Giurescu is our expert in computed imaging procedures. She is responsible for the PET and MRI usages. She is actively researching procedures for Breast imaging.
Dr. Akira Kawashima is one of our top researchers with long experience in Radiology. He is the responsible for the Radiology area at CPM. He is mainly interested in Genitourinary radiology.

A neurologist, Foreman is member of specialists at Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital's Diagnostic Medicine Department. Foreman attended Columbia University as an undergraduate before matriculating at the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine. He had a 4.0 GPA through medical school.
